references.paper_title: Piecewise deterministic sampling with splitting schemes
references.reason: This paper introduces splitting schemes for approximating the backward process in PDMP-based generative models, which are crucial for efficient simulation.

references.paper_title: The zig-zag process and super-efficient sampling for Bayesian analysis of big data
references.reason: This paper introduces the Zig-Zag process, one of the key PDMPs used in the proposed generative models, which has several advantages over Langevin diffusion based methods.

This paper introduces the Randomized Hamiltonian Monte Carlo, another key PDMP used in the proposed generative models, providing an alternative to Langevin diffusions with better scalability in high dimensions.

references.paper_title: The Bouncy Particle Sampler: A Nonreversible Rejection-Free Markov Chain Monte Carlo Method
references.reason: This paper introduces the Bouncy Particle Sampler, a third key PDMP used in the proposed generative models, offering a rejection-free approach with better scalability than Metropolis-Hastings.
